availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Warner (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Father of John Warner and William Warner. Married to Georgia Warner. Father of Margaret Warner, Georgia Warner, Mary Warner, Dabbie Warner, Leslie C. Warner, Ann E. Warner, William A. Warner Jr., and Emma Warner. Farmer in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a colonel from February 8, 1862 to December 18, 1863. Wounded and captured at Battle of Richmond, Kentucky. Paroled on August 30, 1862. Discharged for disability on December 18, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 341A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 183A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Carroll County, Wakenda, p. 432A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0318.
"William A. Warner (1817-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial 64577894, accessed July 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64577894.
